text: hi everyone
Anthony Pantano here Internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review
the XX coexist being sex
you always are my Neos xx the XX is a
London quartet turned trio who made its
full-length debut three short years ago
that man that that album this album
turned heads around the world these guys
made out to a lot of year-end lists with
this LP a lot of adoration across the
Indies sphere as well as a Mercury Prize
under their belts but admittedly I did
not like this album really honestly
outside of a few tracks
I still don't and I will explain my
reasons why in this review but first let
me try to I guess sort of paint a
picture of what makes the XX so
appealing the XX pretty much writes very
skeletal simple indie pop that that is
quiet as the Dickens and the music also
feature some pretty subtle R&B
influences and some very crisp beats
inspired by electronic music as well
pretty much every X extract is fronted
by these very breathy understated
boy/girl vocals that deliver lyrics
about lust and and longing desire and
and love on the rocks and all of these
ingredients kind of add up to an end
product that is perceived to be very shy
but also very sexy and sensual and
understated but kind of emotive and
passionate as well LLL but for me
hearing what somebody is shooting for
and actually feeling it it being a thing
that is just so thick and and tangible
in the music are two completely
different things and that's where I'm
coming from on the debut that's where
I'm coming from with the XX in general
as much as they try to drum all of these
sexy lustful and and very shy emotions
up I just don't really connect with any
of them I do think these guys have style
you know I will give them that they have
great production to go along with that
style as well but to me
execution matters writing matters and I
kind of feel like that's where the XX
suffers to go back to the emotion I know
people are pulling them primarily from
the vocals on the xx's tracks and I
think in this case people are really
kind of construing being quiet and just
being very you know whispery with with
being passionate I could definitely see
someone likening what the xxxx does to
lover whispering in your ear but I can't
help but feel like interpreting the xx's
vocals as just an overall lack of
emotion of authentic emotion because all
the vocals on the self here delivered
with the the same flat Moni faked orgasm
like mumbles it's like a facade they
just put on to perform these songs and
you know I understand it's music it's
entertainment everything is a facade to
an extent but to me nothing the XX does
suspends belief especially when I'm
hearing miss Croft and as an image
straining when they're singing either
missing notes or just kind of weaving in
and out of pitch usually I can see
myself seeing past something like that
if I feel like there's a really awesome
attitude or just emotion behind a vocal
but I'm just not getting that from the
xx like I know a lot of people are
transmission not being received another
thing that kind of keeps this connection
from happening is that I feel like the
lyrics that the XX writes are so vague
the lack of details in
in a number of these tracks could make
it so that just about anybody could
apply their personal situation to the
song and that to me kind of reads us as
being generic as being shallow I mean
what separates one thing from another
thing are the details everything the XX
says only adds up to a very roughly
sketched emotion the only thing on this
LP and their previous LP that I think
the XX are great at are consistent with
is creating some nice grooves creating a
very subtle atmosphere very kind of
serene very pleasant to the ears I like
the idea that they had for the opener to
just kind of pair the vocals with with
just a guitar it really kind of to me
had had a modernized Motown kind of feel
to it
I love the chord progression on the
track missing that's really nice the
song fiction to me has really one of the
darkest beats I've ever heard the XX
produce and I love how they kind of
color it with this really long dark deep
piano note the piano on the track swept
away is really beautiful and delicate
and the addition of strings on the track
tides I mean they sound great - nice
touch but to me these are just kind of
motifs and moods because on a lot of
these tracks the XX just kind of boughs
out or just ends a song abruptly because
it doesn't seem like they know how to
really tie something together and create
a finish especially on the track chains
which to me is an example of another
issue that I have with this album while
the XX is great at creating an
instrumental mood or groove whenever
they try to make something stand out
like the guitar solo toward the end of
that track it just comes out really
really bad however if you like this
album if you really love this album
adjust the XX in general I understand I
mean what they're trying to do
emotionally appeals to you it connects
with you you know it does not with me I
mean I'm sure that's going to make some
fans happy that they kind of stuck to
their guns but I really kind of feel
like they said everything they had to
say on that debut album until they drum
up
different idea coexist does work with a
few different beats you know you kind of
catch a future garage beat on here in a
moment that that kind of sounds like it
would be nice backing a burial track and
these guys definitely do try to vary
things up a little bit instrumentally
and production wise but but still you
know all those things I mentioned
there's still things I don't like about
this album so I'm kind of feeling strong
for to a light five on this LP if you
dig it you dig it if you don't you don't
but whether or not you do or don't let
me know did you love this did you hate
this why and what should I review next
anthony Fantana the XX forever
[Music]
